page.title: 05 WESTENHANGER VILLAGE
page.content: Westenhanger is situated on Stone or 'Stane'Street, the old Roman road running from Canterbury to the coast. It was once a part of the village of Stanford but was cut off from it by the new motorway(M.20). The name comes from a local mansion,now demolished,built by Henry the Second. It is now just a collection It is now just a collection of about thirty houses varying from two-bedroomed terraced to large detached. There are no shops,the nearest bus sevice is from Newingreen. It has a limited stop main-line halt. The only amenity is the Folkestone Racecourse.There are about 20 meetings a year,usually on Mondays and Tuesdays.
